Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw two people communicating from a distance using a string telephone.
The student can illustrate that the device uses sound to send messages between the two people.
The student can show the length of the string as a key feature of the device for effective communication, though the concept of tension might be slightly inconsistent.
The student can draw only the materials necessary for building the string telephone, such as two cups and a string.
The student can depict in a basic way how sound travels along the string from one cup to the other through some form of labeling or arrows.
CANNOT: The student might inconsistently apply labels to explain how the string telephone works, sometimes forgetting to label parts like the cups or string.
The student may occasionally omit or incorrectly place arrows showing the direction in which sound travels along the string, reflecting minor gaps in complete understanding.
